awd_titl_txt: Acquisition of a Micro Fourier Transform Infrared           Spectrometer
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides one-half of the funds required to                      purchase a micro-Fourier Transform infrared spectrometer system.                The equipment will be housed and operated in the Department of                  Geology and Geophysics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison.                  The University will provide the remaining 50% match for the                     purchase and will also provide laboratory space and the technical               support to maintain the machine.                                                     The infrared spectrometer research at Wisconsin will focus                 on developing applications to determine the composition of                      microscopic fluids trapped in rocks and minerals and their use in               interpreting deep crustal processes.
